title: Want to avoid a collapsing star? Don't get drawn into its orbit in the first place
text:
Four whole months. That’s how long it has taken the administrator of Neil Woodford’s flagship fund to come to the conclusion that “it is in the best interests of investors for the [fund] to be wound up”.

Why so long? It’s a mystery. Those tasked with ensuring that the financial system works effectively and fairly have responded to the scandal meekly.

The celebrity stockpicker should never have been allowed to continue once it became clear that customers were being denied access to their savings indefinitely. He has been pocketing £100,000 in fees every day since his Equity Income fund was gated at the start of June. The FCA and the Bank of England have the powers to step in and protect customers....
